means: <正>结果
端
终止
最后部分
结束，终止
[人名] 恩德
[地名] 角（英语）
endurance 耐力
endorphin 内啡肽
beta-endorphin β-内啡肽
endurance trained 耐力训练

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"目标，目的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: aim, goal, purpose, end, target, object, objective
means: aim ：从本义"靶子"引申而来，侧重比较具体而明确的目标，但常指短期目标。
goal ：指经过考虑和选择，需经坚持不懈的努力奋斗才能达到的最终目标。
purpose ：普通用词，既指以坚决、审慎的行动去达到的目的，又指心中渴望要实际的目标。
end ：指心目中怀着的某种目的，强调结果而非过程。较正式用词。
target ：指射击的靶，军事攻击目标。引申指被攻击、批评或潮笑的目标。
object ：强调个人或需求而决定的目标、目的。
objective ：与object基本同义，但语义更广泛，指具体或很快能达到的目的，也可指军事目标。书面用词。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"结束，完成"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: complete, finish, end, close, conclude, terminate, accomplish
means: complete ： 侧重指完成预定的任务或使某事完善，补足缺少的部分等。
finish ： 与complete基本同义，着重圆满地结束或完成已着手的事。
end ： 最普通用词，着重事情的完成。也指某种活动因达到目的而自然结束或由于某种原因而突然中止。
close ： 普通用词，着重行为的终止或结束，不强调其目的。
conclude ： 正式用词，多指以某事或活动达到预期目的而告终。
terminate ： 强调有一个空间和时间的限度，届时必须终止。书面语用词。
accomplish ： 正式用词，强调一个过程的完成；也可指依靠努力达到一定目的，或取得一定的结果。

sentence.Network_en: The agreement has raised hopes that the war may end soon.
sentence.Network_cn: 那项协议使人们感到战争有望很快结束。

sentence.Network_en: Rationing had put an end to a surfeit of biscuits long ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 定量供应很久以前就结束了饼干过剩的状况。

sentence.Network_en: He had wandered to the far end of the room.

phrase.cizu_name: at the end of the day

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly Brit.)when everything is taken into consideration

lj.lj_ly: at the end of the day I'm responsible for what happens in the school.
lj.lj_ls: 到头来，还是我对学校发生的事负责。

phrase.cizu_name: be at (或 have come to) an end

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a supply of something) become exhausted

lj.lj_ly: our patience has come to an end.
lj.lj_ls: 我们一点儿耐心都没有了。

jx.jx_en_mean: be close to having no more of (something)

lj.lj_ly: she was at the end of her patience.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)be the limit of what one can tolerate
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)是所能忍受的最大限度，达到了忍耐极限

phrase.cizu_name: come to (或 meet) a sticky (或 bad) end

jx.jx_en_mean: be led by one's own actions to ruin or an unpleasant death
jx.jx_cn_mean: 遭到报应；落得悲惨下场；不得好死

jx.jx_en_mean: a thing that is final or definitive
spend the final part of one's  existence in a specified place or state

lj.lj_ly: she ended her days in London.

jx.jx_en_mean: a goal that is pursued in its own right to the exclusion of others
have an unhappy or painful outcome (often as a warning)
jx.jx_cn_mean: （常作告诫语）会有不愉快（或痛苦）的结局；有苦果

lj.lj_ly: this treaty will end in tears.

jx.jx_en_mean: the point beyond which progress or survival cannot continue
jx.jx_cn_mean: 生命（或事物发展）的尽头；穷途末路；完蛋

lj.lj_ly: if the damages award is not lowered it could be the end of the road for the publisher.
lj.lj_ls: 若不降低损害赔偿金，那家出版公司可能就完了。

phrase.cizu_name: the end of one's tether (或北美rope)

jx.jx_en_mean: having no patience or energy left to cope with something

lj.lj_ly: these individuals have reached the end of their tether. .
lj.lj_ls: 这些人已忍无可忍（或筋疲力尽）了。

jx.jx_en_mean: the termination of life on the earth

means.word_mean: 中断;结束
结束;终结
限度;终结;结果
其他释义
结束;末端;终止
结束;收场
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ende (noun), endian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch einde (noun), einden (verb) and German Ende (noun), enden (verb)

entry.def: The end of something such as a period of time, an event, a book, or a film is the last part of it or the final point in it.

example.ex: The £5 banknote was first issued at the end of the 18th century...
example.tran: 五英镑面值的钞票最早在18世纪末发行。

example.ex: The report is expected by the end of the year...
example.tran: 预期年底提交报告。

entry.def: When a situation, process, or activity ends, or when something or someone ends it, it reaches its final point and stops.

example.ex: The meeting quickly ended and Steve and I left the room...
example.tran: 会议很快结束了，我和史蒂夫离开了房间。

example.ex: Talks have resumed to try to end the fighting...
example.tran: 会谈重新开始，以期结束战斗。

entry.def: An end to something or the end of it is the act or result of stopping it so that it does not continue any longer.

example.ex: The French government today called for an end to the violence...
example.tran: 今天法国政府呼吁结束暴力行为。

example.ex: I was worried she would walk out or bring the interview to an end...
example.tran: 我担心她会离场或者终止采访。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something ends a period of time in a particular way, you are indicating what the final situation was like. You can also say that a period of time ends in a particular way.

example.ex: The markets ended the week on a quiet note...
example.tran: 全球股市波澜不惊地结束了一周的交易。

example.ex: British Gas shares ended the day 1p up at 287p...
example.tran: 英国天然气公司股价上涨1便士，以287便士收盘。

entry.def: If a period of time ends, it reaches its final point.

example.ex: Its monthly reports on program trading usually come out about three weeks after each month ends...
example.tran: 程式交易月度报告通常在每月结束3周后出来。

example.ex: The first figure shows sales for week ending July 27.
example.tran: 第一组数据显示截至7月27日的周销售量。

entry.tran: (书、演说、表演等)以…为结尾，以…结束
entry.def: If something such as a book, speech, or performance ends with a particular thing or the writer or performer ends it with that thing, its final part consists of the thing mentioned.

example.ex: His statement ended with the words: 'Pray for me.'...
example.tran: 他的声明以“为我祈祷”结束。

example.ex: The book ends on a lengthy description of Hawaii...
example.tran: 这本书以对夏威夷的冗长描述为结尾。

entry.def: If a situation or event ends in a particular way, it has that particular result.

example.ex: The incident could have ended in tragedy...
example.tran: 这起事件本会以悲剧收场。

example.ex: The match ended in a draw...
example.tran: 那场比赛以平局收场。

entry.def: The two ends of something long and narrow are the two points or parts of it that are furthest away from each other.

example.ex: The company is planning to place surveillance equipment at both ends of the tunnel...
example.tran: 该公司计划在隧道两端安装监视设备。

example.ex: A typical fluorescent lamp is a tube with metal electrodes at each end.
example.tran: 日光灯通常是一根两端装有金属电极的管子。

entry.def: The end of a long, narrow object such as a finger or a pencil is the tip or smallest edge of it, usually the part that is furthest away from you.

example.ex: He tapped the ends of his fingers together...
example.tran: 他同时轻轻地叩击着几根指尖。

example.ex: She let the long cone of ash hang at the end of her cigarette.
example.tran: 她让长长的烟灰留在烟头上。

entry.def: If an object ends with or in a particular thing, it has that thing on its tip or point, or as its last part.

example.ex: It has three pairs of legs, each ending in a large claw.
example.tran: 它有3对腿，每条腿上都有一只巨爪。

entry.def: A journey, road, or river that ends at a particular place stops there and goes no further.

example.ex: The road ended at a T-junction...
example.tran: 道路的尽头是一个丁字路口。

example.ex: The journey ends in the ancient city of Marrakesh.
example.tran: 旅行的终点是马拉喀什古城。

entry.def: End is used to refer to either of the two extreme points of a scale, or of something that you are considering as a scale.

example.ex: At the other end of the social scale was the grocer, the village's only merchant...
example.tran: 社会等级的另一端是杂货店老板，村里唯一的商人。

example.ex: The agreement has been criticised by extremist groups on both ends of the political spectrum.
example.tran: 协议遭到了极左翼和极右翼极端团体的批评。

entry.tran: (联系、旅行等的)一端，一方，一头
entry.def: The other end is one of two places that are connected because people are communicating with each other by telephone or writing, or are travelling from one place to the other.

example.ex: When he answered the phone, Ferguson was at the other end...
example.tran: 他接电话时，电话那一端是弗格森。

example.ex: There was silence at the other end of the line...
example.tran: 电话那头没有声音。

entry.def: If you refer to a particular end of a project or piece of work, you mean a part or aspect of it, for example a part of it that is done by a particular person or in a particular place.

example.ex: You take care of your end, kid, I'll take care of mine...
example.tran: 你管好你的事，孩子，我会管好我的。

example.ex: Let's go up to the office and settle the business end of things.
example.tran: 咱们上楼到办公室去把公事搞定。

entry.def: An end is the purpose for which something is done or towards which you are working.

example.ex: The police force is being manipulated for political ends...
example.tran: 有人为了政治目的在操纵警方。

example.ex: Now the government is trying another policy designed to achieve the same end.
example.tran: 现在政府正在尝试实现殊途同归的另一项政策。

entry.tran: 只存在于，仅限于（某一点）
entry.def: If you say that something ends at a particular point, you mean that it is applied or exists up to that point, and no further.

example.ex: Helen is also 25 and from Birmingham, but the similarity ends there...
example.tran: 海伦也是25岁，也来自伯明翰，但是相同之处仅此而已。

example.ex: Does responsibility end at the fitting of car seats?
example.tran: 只负责安装好汽车座椅吗？

entry.def: You can refer to someone's death as their end, especially when you are talking about the way that they died or might die.

example.ex: Soon after we had spoken to this man he had met a violent end.
example.tran: 我们和这个人谈话之后没多久，他就死于非命了。

entry.def: If you end by doing something or end in a particular state, you do that thing or get into that state even though you did not originally intend to.

example.ex: They ended by making themselves miserable...
example.tran: 结果是他们自找苦头。

example.ex: They'll probably end back on the streets.
example.tran: 他们最后可能又会流落街头。

entry.def: If someone ends it all, they kill themselves.

example.ex: He grew suicidal, thinking up ways to end it all.
example.tran: 他萌生了自杀的念头，想出各种自我了断的办法。

entry.def: If you describe something as, for example, the deal to end all deals or the film to end all films, you mean that it is very important or successful, and that compared to it all other deals or films seem second-rate.

example.ex: It was going to be a party to end all parties.
example.tran: 这将成为最棒的聚会。

example.ex: ...the sale to end all sales at Harrods.
example.tran: 哈罗兹最大的一次特价促销

entry.def: If something is at an end, it has finished and will not continue.

example.ex: The court has passed sentence and the matter is now at an end...
example.tran: 法庭已经作出了判决，现在这件事已经告一段落。

example.ex: The recession is definitely at an end.
example.tran: 经济衰退无疑已经告终。

entry.def: If something comes to an end, it stops.

example.ex: The cold war came to an end.
example.tran: 冷战结束了。

entry.def: You say at the end of the day when you are talking about what happens after a long series of events or what appears to be the case after you have considered the relevant facts.

example.ex: At the end of the day it's up to the Germans to decide...
example.tran: 最终得由德国人来作决定。

example.ex: At the end of the day, the board's not going to be too concerned with three or four more dollars.
example.tran: 到头来，董事会不会太操心多花了几个钱。

entry.tran: 变得神志不清;变得不正常
entry.def: If you say that someone has gone off the deep end, you mean that their mind has stopped working in a normal way and their behaviour has become very strange as a result.

example.ex: I'm not sure she believes me. She probably just thinks I've gone off the deep end.
example.tran: 我不确定她是不是相信我。她可能只是觉得我神志不清了。

entry.tran: (使)落入一无所知的无助境地
entry.def: If you are thrown in at the deep end, you are put in a completely new situation without any help or preparation. If you jump in at the deep end, you go into a completely new situation without any help or preparation.

example.ex: It's a superb job. You get thrown in at the deep end and it's all down to you...
example.tran: 那是一份绝好的工作。你就像被抛到了泳池的深水区，一切都要靠自己。

example.ex: The reason many people fail on diets is that they jump in at the deep end, making a complete change to their eating habits.
example.tran: 很多人节食失败的原因是他们对节食一窍不通，一下子完全改变了饮食习惯。

entry.def: If you do something to the bitter end or to the very end, you continue to do it for as long as you can, although it may be very unpleasant or dangerous.

example.ex: We will fight to the bitter end to ensure our children get what is rightfully theirs.
example.tran: 我们会斗争到底，确保我们的孩子得到理应属于他们的东西。

entry.def: You say in the end when you are saying what is the final result of a series of events, or what is your final conclusion after considering all the relevant facts.

example.ex: I toyed with the idea of calling the police, but in the end I didn't...
example.tran: 我拿不定主意是否报警，但最后还是没报。

example.ex: Benny thought the president was sincere and sensitive, but, in the end, that's not what counts.
example.tran: 本尼认为总统很诚恳，会体谅人，但归根结底那些都没有用。

entry.def: If you consider something to be an end in itself, you do it because it seems desirable and not because it is likely to lead to something else.

example.ex: While he had originally traveled in order to study, traveling had become an end in itself.
example.tran: 尽管他原本是为了学习而旅行，但旅行过程本身也是一种享受。

entry.tran: 坚持下去；尽自己的本分;做好自己的本职工作
entry.def: If you have to keep your end up, or to keep up your end of something, you have to do something as well as other people, or as well as you are expected to do it.

example.ex: I had to keep my end up with other professors in the faculty...
example.tran: 我得和系里其他教授一起做好自己的本职工作。

example.ex: He had trouble keeping up his end of a technical discussion.
example.tran: 他没能在一场技术探讨中坚持自己的立场。

entry.tran: 使收支相抵;勉强维持生计
entry.def: If you find it difficult to make ends meet, you can only just manage financially because you hardly have enough money for the things you need.

example.ex: With Betty's salary they barely made ends meet.
example.tran: 加上贝蒂的薪水，他们仅能勉强维持生计。

entry.def: No end means a lot.

example.ex: The problem was causing the poor woman no end of misery...
example.tran: 那个问题给这个可怜的女人带来了很多痛苦。

example.ex: Teachers inform me that Tracey's behaviour has improved no end.
example.tran: 老师们告诉我特雷西的行为大有改善。

entry.def: When something happens for hours, days, weeks, or years on end, it happens continuously and without stopping for the amount of time that is mentioned.

example.ex: He is a wonderful companion and we can talk for hours on end...
example.tran: 他是个非常好的同伴，我们可以连续聊上好几个小时。

example.ex: I spend days on end in this studio.
example.tran: 我一连几天呆在这个工作室里。

entry.def: Something that is on end is upright, instead of in its normal or natural position, for example lying down, flat, or on its longest side.
To put an end to something means to cause it to stop.

example.ex: Only a political solution could put an end to the violence.
example.tran: 只有政治解决方案才能终结暴力。

entry.def: If a process or person has reached the end of the road, they are unable to progress any further.

example.ex: Given the results of the vote, is this the end of the road for the hardliners in Congress?
example.tran: 从选举结果来看，这是不是国会中强硬派的末日？

entry.def: If you say that something will happen or be true until the end of time or to the end of time, you are emphasizing that it will always happen or always be true.

example.ex: We can assume that the moon will continue to go around the earth until the end of time...
example.tran: 我们可以认定月亮会一直不停地继续围绕地球旋转。

example.ex: I'll love her till the end of time.
example.tran: 我会爱她直到永远。

entry.tran: 不是世界末日;没那么可怕
entry.def: If you say that something bad is not the end of the world, you are trying to stop yourself or someone else being so upset by it, by suggesting that it is not the worst thing that could happen.

example.ex: Obviously I'd be disappointed if we don't make it, but it wouldn't be the end of the world.
example.tran: 显然，如果我们做不到我会失望，但这也不会是世界末日。

means.word_mean: 1. either extremity of something that has length;

sentences.sentence: "the end of the pier"
"she knotted the end of the thread"
"they rode to the end of the line"

means.word_mean: 2. the point in time at which something ends;

sentences.sentence: "the end of the year"
"the ending of warranty period"

means.word_mean: 3. the concluding parts of an event or occurrence;

sentences.sentence: "the end was exciting"
"I had to miss the last of the movie"

means.word_mean: 4. the state of affairs that a plan is intended to achieve and that (when achieved) terminates behavior intended to achieve it;

sentences.sentence: "the ends justify the means"

means.word_mean: 5. a final part or section;

sentences.sentence: "we have given it at the end of the section since it involves the calculus"
"Start at the beginning and go on until you come to the end"

means.word_mean: 6. a final state;

sentences.sentence: "he came to a bad end"
"the so-called glorious experiment came to an inglorious end"

means.word_mean: 7. the surface at either extremity of a three-dimensional object;

sentences.sentence: "one end of the box was marked `This side up'"

means.word_mean: 8. (football) the person who plays at one end of the line of scrimmage;

sentences.sentence: "the end managed to hold onto the pass"

means.word_mean: 9. one of two places from which people are communicating to each other;

sentences.sentence: "the phone rang at the other end"
"both ends wrote at the same time"

means.word_mean: 10. a boundary marking the extremities of something;

sentences.sentence: "the end of town"

means.word_mean: 11. the part you are expected to play;

sentences.sentence: "he held up his end"

means.word_mean: 12. the last section of a communication;

sentences.sentence: "in conclusion I want to say..."

means.word_mean: 13. a piece of cloth that is left over after the rest has been used or sold
14. a position on the line of scrimmage;

sentences.sentence: "no one wanted to play end"

means.word_mean: 1. have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical;

sentences.sentence: "the bronchioles terminate in a capillary bed"
"Your rights stop where you infringe upon the rights of other"
"My property ends by the bushes"
"The symphony ends in a pianissimo"

means.word_mean: 2. bring to an end or halt;

sentences.sentence: "She ended their friendship when she found out that he had once been convicted of a crime"
"The attack on Poland terminated the relatively peaceful period after WWI"

means.word_mean: 3. be the end of; be the last or concluding part of;

sentences.sentence: "This sad scene ended the movie"

means.word_mean: 4. put an end to;

sentences.sentence: "The terrible news ended our hopes that he had survived"

list.explanation: 采取断然或激烈的行动

example.en: He jumped off the deep end and got married again.
example.zh: 他断然地采取了行动，并且再次结了婚。

auth_sentence.content: Place them at the other end of the plates.
auth_sentence.res_content: Place them at the other end of the plates.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Place them at the other end of the plates.

auth_sentence.content: The whistle goes for the end of normal time.
auth_sentence.res_content: The whistle goes for the end of normal time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The whistle goes for the end of normal time.

auth_sentence.content: When the end came, it came very suddenly.
auth_sentence.res_content: When the end came, it came very suddenly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When the end came, it came very suddenly.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 已签署(背书)；由……签署(背书)

means.word_mean: 最后部分, 末尾

sentences.en: We must fight on until the end.

means.word_mean: 终止, 结局

sentences.en: Don't give away the end of the story.

means.word_mean: 〈正〉结果, 目标, 目的

sentences.en: Do the ends justify the means?
sentences.cn: 只要目的正当就可以不择手段吗?

means.word_mean: 死去

sentences.en: That face called up in his mind the image of his end wife.
sentences.cn: 那张脸使他想起了他亡妻的形象。

means.word_mean: 结束; 终止

jushi.english: That face called up in his mind the image of his end wife.
jushi.chinese: 那张脸使他在脑海里出现了他亡妻的形象。

jushi.english: Every club member must pay up his membership money before the end of the season.
jushi.chinese: 每一位俱乐部成员必须在赛季结束以前缴清会费。

jushi.english: Don't give away the end of the story.
